case_vignette: A 55-year-old black man presents for evaluation of fine wrinkles that had developed over the past year. Physical examination reveals diffuse areas offine wrinkling that run parallel to lines of cleavage on his neck, chest, axilla, trunk, back, and upper arms bilaterally. The affected skin has normal pigmentation and lacks erythema, induration, and atrophy. Lateral tension obliterates the wrinkling. The patient never notes any inflammation, itching, or pain. There are no signs or symptoms of systemic involvement. He denies sunbathing and denies any history of skin disorders or other significant health problems. The patient is a nonsmoker and has a family history of skin cancer. He has a history of sun protection and has used sunscreen regularly. The patient's past medical history is unremarkable. The patient's family history is significant for a first-degree relative with skin cancer. The patient's social history is unremarkable. The patient's physical examination is otherwise unremarkable. The patient's skin examination is significant for fine wrinkling that is consistent with photoaging. The patient's skin examination is also significant for a few scattered actinic keratoses. The patient's skin examination is otherwise unremarkable. The patient's skin examination is significant for a few scattered actinic keratoses. multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have developed fine wrinkles on my neck, chest, axilla, trunk, back, and upper arms over the past year.
How old are you?
I am 55 years old.
Are there any changes in the texture or elasticity of the affected skin?
The affected skin has normal pigmentation and lacks any hardness or thinning, and when I pull it sideways, the wrinkling disappears.
Do you have any chronic medical conditions or are you currently on any medication?
No, I don't have any history of significant health problems and I'm not on any medication.
Is there any family history of similar skin conditions or other dermatological diseases?
I have a family history of skin cancer, but no other reported skin conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Mid-dermal Elastolysis.

The patient has no significant health problems and is not on any medication. There is a family history of skin cancer, but no other skin conditions are reported.
